2426 def _update_line_limits(self, line):
2427 """
2428 Figures out the data limit of the given line, updating `.Axes.dataLim`.
2429 """
2430 path = line.get_path()
2431 if path.vertices.size == 0:
2432 return
2433
2434 line_trf = line.get_transform()
2435
2436 if line_trf == self.transData:
2437 data_path = path
2438 elif any(line_trf.contains_branch_seperately(self.transData)):
2439 # Compute the transform from line coordinates to data coordinates.
2440 trf_to_data = line_trf - self.transData
2441 # If transData is affine we can use the cached non-affine component
2442 # of line's path (since the non-affine part of line_trf is
2443 # entirely encapsulated in trf_to_data).
2444 if self.transData.is_affine:
2445 line_trans_path = line._get_transformed_path()
2446 na_path, _ = line_trans_path.get_transformed_path_and_affine()
2447 data_path = trf_to_data.transform_path_affine(na_path)
2448 else:
2449 data_path = trf_to_data.transform_path(path)
2450 else:
2451 # For backwards compatibility we update the dataLim with the
2452 # coordinate range of the given path, even though the coordinate
2453 # systems are completely different. This may occur in situations
2454 # such as when ax.transAxes is passed through for absolute
2455 # positioning.
2456 data_path = path
2457
2458 if not data_path.vertices.size:
2459 return
2460
2461 updatex, updatey = line_trf.contains_branch_seperately(self.transData)
2462 if self.name != "rectilinear":
2463 # This block is mostly intended to handle axvline in polar plots,
2464 # for which updatey would otherwise be True.
2465 if updatex and line_trf == self.get_yaxis_transform():
2466 updatex = False
2467 if updatey and line_trf == self.get_xaxis_transform():
2468 updatey = False
2469 self.dataLim.update_from_path(data_path,
2470 self.ignore_existing_data_limits,
2471 updatex=updatex, updatey=updatey)
2472 self.ignore_existing_data_limits = False
2473
2474 def add_patch(self, p):
2475 """
2476 Add a `.Patch` to the Axes; return the patch.
2477 """
2478 _api.check_isinstance(mpatches.Patch, p=p)
2479 self._set_artist_props(p)
2480 if p.get_clip_path() is None:
2481 p.set_clip_path(self.patch)
2482 self._update_patch_limits(p)
2483 self._children.append(p)
2484 p._remove_method = self._children.remove
2485 return p
2486
2487 def _update_patch_limits(self, patch):
2488 """Update the data limits for the given patch."""
2489 # hist can add zero height Rectangles, which is useful to keep
2490 # the bins, counts and patches lined up, but it throws off log
2491 # scaling. We'll ignore rects with zero height or width in
2492 # the auto-scaling
2493
2494 # cannot check for '==0' since unitized data may not compare to zero
2495 # issue #2150 - we update the limits if patch has non zero width
2496 # or height.
2497 if (isinstance(patch, mpatches.Rectangle) and
2498 ((not patch.get_width()) and (not patch.get_height()))):
2499 return
2500 p = patch.get_path()
2501 # Get all vertices on the path
2502 # Loop through each segment to get extrema for Bezier curve sections
2503 vertices = []
2504 for curve, code in p.iter_bezier(simplify=False):
2505 # Get distance along the curve of any extrema
2506 _, dzeros = curve.axis_aligned_extrema()
2507 # Calculate vertices of start, end and any extrema in between
2508 vertices.append(curve([0, *dzeros, 1]))
2509
2510 if len(vertices):
2511 vertices = np.vstack(vertices)
2512
2513 patch_trf = patch.get_transform()
2514 updatex, updatey = patch_trf.contains_branch_seperately(self.transData)
2515 if not (updatex or updatey):
2516 return
2517 if self.name != "rectilinear":
2518 # As in _update_line_limits, but for axvspan.
2519 if updatex and patch_trf == self.get_yaxis_transform():
2520 updatex = False
2521 if updatey and patch_trf == self.get_xaxis_transform():
2522 updatey = False
2523 trf_to_data = patch_trf - self.transData
2524 xys = trf_to_data.transform(vertices)
2525 self.update_datalim(xys, updatex=updatex, updatey=updatey)
2526

2550 def _unit_change_handler(self, axis_name, event=None):
2551 """
2552 Process axis units changes: requests updates to data and view limits.
2553 """
2554 if event is None: # Allow connecting `self._unit_change_handler(name)`
2555 return functools.partial(
2556 self._unit_change_handler, axis_name, event=object())
2557 _api.check_in_list(self._axis_map, axis_name=axis_name)
2558 for line in self.lines:
2559 line.recache_always()
2560 self.relim()
2561 self._request_autoscale_view(axis_name)

2563 def relim(self, visible_only=False):
2564 """
2565 Recompute the data limits based on current artists.
2566
2567 At present, `.Collection` instances are not supported.
2568
2569 Parameters
2570 ----------
2571 visible_only : bool, default: False
2572 Whether to exclude invisible artists.
2573 """
2574 # Collections are deliberately not supported (yet); see
2575 # the TODO note in artists.py.
2576 self.dataLim.ignore(True)
2577 self.dataLim.set_points(mtransforms.Bbox.null().get_points())
2578 self.ignore_existing_data_limits = True
2579
2580 for artist in self._children:
2581 if not visible_only or artist.get_visible():
2582 if isinstance(artist, mlines.Line2D):
2583 self._update_line_limits(artist)
2584 elif isinstance(artist, mpatches.Patch):
2585 self._update_patch_limits(artist)
2586 elif isinstance(artist, mimage.AxesImage):
2587 self._update_image_limits(artist)
2588
2589 def update_datalim(self, xys, updatex=True, updatey=True):
2590 """
2591 Extend the `~.Axes.dataLim` Bbox to include the given points.
2592
2593 If no data is set currently, the Bbox will ignore its limits and set
2594 the bound to be the bounds of the xydata (*xys*). Otherwise, it will
2595 compute the bounds of the union of its current data and the data in
2596 *xys*.
2597
2598 Parameters
2599 ----------
2600 xys : 2D array-like
2601 The points to include in the data limits Bbox. This can be either
2602 a list of (x, y) tuples or a (N, 2) array.
2603
2604 updatex, updatey : bool, default: True
2605 Whether to update the x/y limits.
2606 """
2607 xys = np.asarray(xys)
2608 if not np.any(np.isfinite(xys)):
2609 return
2610 self.dataLim.update_from_data_xy(xys, self.ignore_existing_data_limits,
2611 updatex=updatex, updatey=updatey)
2612 self.ignore_existing_data_limits = False
2613
2614 def _process_unit_info(self, datasets=None, kwargs=None, *, convert=True):
2615 """
2616 Set axis units based on *datasets* and *kwargs*, and optionally apply
2617 unit conversions to *datasets*.
2618
2619 Parameters
2620 ----------
2621 datasets : list
2622 List of (axis_name, dataset) pairs (where the axis name is defined
2623 as in `._axis_map`). Individual datasets can also be None
2624 (which gets passed through).
2625 kwargs : dict
2626 Other parameters from which unit info (i.e., the *xunits*,
2627 *yunits*, *zunits* (for 3D Axes), *runits* and *thetaunits* (for
2628 polar) entries) is popped, if present. Note that this dict is
2629 mutated in-place!
2630 convert : bool, default: True
2631 Whether to return the original datasets or the converted ones.
2632
2633 Returns
2634 -------
2635 list
2636 Either the original datasets if *convert* is False, or the
2637 converted ones if *convert* is True (the default).
2638 """
2639 # The API makes datasets a list of pairs rather than an axis_name to
2640 # dataset mapping because it is sometimes necessary to process multiple
2641 # datasets for a single axis, and concatenating them may be tricky
2642 # (e.g. if some are scalars, etc.).
2643 datasets = datasets or []
2644 kwargs = kwargs or {}
2645 axis_map = self._axis_map
2646 for axis_name, data in datasets:
2647 try:
2648 axis = axis_map[axis_name]
2649 except KeyError:
2650 raise ValueError(f"Invalid axis name: {axis_name!r}") from None
2651 # Update from data if axis is already set but no unit is set yet.
2652 if axis is not None and data is not None and not axis.have_units():
2653 axis.update_units(data)
2654 for axis_name, axis in axis_map.items():
2655 # Return if no axis is set.
2656 if axis is None:
2657 continue
2658 # Check for units in the kwargs, and if present update axis.
2659 units = kwargs.pop(f"{axis_name}units", axis.units)
2660 if self.name == "polar":
2661 # Special case: polar supports "thetaunits"/"runits".
2662 polar_units = {"x": "thetaunits", "y": "runits"}
2663 units = kwargs.pop(polar_units[axis_name], units)
2664 if units != axis.units and units is not None:
2665 axis.set_units(units)
2666 # If the units being set imply a different converter,
2667 # we need to update again.
2668 for dataset_axis_name, data in datasets:
2669 if dataset_axis_name == axis_name and data is not None:
2670 axis.update_units(data)
2671 return [axis_map[axis_name].convert_units(data)
2672 if convert and data is not None else data
2673 for axis_name, data in datasets]
2674

2676 """
2677 Return whether the given event (in display coords) is in the Axes.
2678 """
2679 return self.patch.contains(mouseevent)[0]

2756
2757 def set_xmargin(self, m):
2758 """
2759 Set padding of X data limits prior to autoscaling.
2760
2761 *m* times the data interval will be added to each end of that interval
2762 before it is used in autoscaling. If *m* is negative, this will clip
2763 the data range instead of expanding it.
2764
2765 For example, if your data is in the range [0, 2], a margin of 0.1 will
2766 result in a range [-0.2, 2.2]; a margin of -0.1 will result in a range
2767 of [0.2, 1.8].
2768
2769 Parameters
2770 ----------
2771 m : float greater than -0.5
2772 """
2773 if m <= -0.5:
2774 raise ValueError("margin must be greater than -0.5")
2775 self._xmargin = m
2776 self._request_autoscale_view("x")
2777 self.stale = True
2778
2779 def set_ymargin(self, m):
2780 """
2781 Set padding of Y data limits prior to autoscaling.
2782
2783 *m* times the data interval will be added to each end of that interval
2784 before it is used in autoscaling. If *m* is negative, this will clip
2785 the data range instead of expanding it.
2786
2787 For example, if your data is in the range [0, 2], a margin of 0.1 will
2788 result in a range [-0.2, 2.2]; a margin of -0.1 will result in a range
2789 of [0.2, 1.8].
2790
2791 Parameters
2792 ----------
2793 m : float greater than -0.5
2794 """
2795 if m <= -0.5:
2796 raise ValueError("margin must be greater than -0.5")
2797 self._ymargin = m
2798 self._request_autoscale_view("y")
2799 self.stale = True

2801 def margins(self, *margins, x=None, y=None, tight=True):
2802 """
2803 Set or retrieve margins around the data for autoscaling axis limits.
2804
2805 This allows to configure the padding around the data without having to
2806 set explicit limits using `~.Axes.set_xlim` / `~.Axes.set_ylim`.
2807
2808 Autoscaling determines the axis limits by adding *margin* times the
2809 data interval as padding around the data. See the following illustration:
2810
2811 .. plot:: _embedded_plots/axes_margins.py
2812
2813 All input parameters must be floats greater than -0.5. Passing both
2814 positional and keyword arguments is invalid and will raise a TypeError.
2815 If no arguments (positional or otherwise) are provided, the current
2816 margins will remain unchanged and simply be returned.
2817
2818 The default margins are :rc:`axes.xmargin` and :rc:`axes.ymargin`.
2819
2820 Parameters
2821 ----------
2822 *margins : float, optional
2823 If a single positional argument is provided, it specifies
2824 both margins of the x-axis and y-axis limits. If two
2825 positional arguments are provided, they will be interpreted
2826 as *xmargin*, *ymargin*. If setting the margin on a single
2827 axis is desired, use the keyword arguments described below.
2828
2829 x, y : float, optional
2830 Specific margin values for the x-axis and y-axis,
2831 respectively. These cannot be used with positional
2832 arguments, but can be used individually to alter on e.g.,
2833 only the y-axis.
2834
2835 tight : bool or None, default: True
2836 The *tight* parameter is passed to `~.axes.Axes.autoscale_view`,
2837 which is executed after a margin is changed; the default
2838 here is *True*, on the assumption that when margins are
2839 specified, no additional padding to match tick marks is
2840 usually desired. Setting *tight* to *None* preserves
2841 the previous setting.
2842
2843 Returns
2844 -------
2845 xmargin, ymargin : float
2846
2847 Notes
2848 -----
2849 If a previously used Axes method such as :meth:`pcolor` has set
2850 `~.Axes.use_sticky_edges` to `True`, only the limits not set by
2851 the "sticky artists" will be modified. To force all
2852 margins to be set, set `~.Axes.use_sticky_edges` to `False`
2853 before calling :meth:`margins`.
2854
2855 See Also
2856 --------
2857 .Axes.set_xmargin, .Axes.set_ymargin
2858 """
2859
2860 if margins and (x is not None or y is not None):
2861 raise TypeError('Cannot pass both positional and keyword '
2862 'arguments for x and/or y.')
2863 elif len(margins) == 1:
2864 x = y = margins[0]
2865 elif len(margins) == 2:
2866 x, y = margins
2867 elif margins:
2868 raise TypeError('Must pass a single positional argument for all '
2869 'margins, or one for each margin (x, y).')
2870
2871 if x is None and y is None:
2872 if tight is not True:
2873 _api.warn_external(f'ignoring tight={tight!r} in get mode')
2874 return self._xmargin, self._ymargin
2875
2876 if tight is not None:
2877 self._tight = tight
2878 if x is not None:
2879 self.set_xmargin(x)
2880 if y is not None:
2881 self.set_ymargin(y)
2882
2883 def set_rasterization_zorder(self, z):
2884 """
2885 Set the zorder threshold for rasterization for vector graphics output.
2886
2887 All artists with a zorder below the given value will be rasterized if
2888 they support rasterization.
2889
2890 This setting is ignored for pixel-based output.
2891
2892 See also :doc:`/gallery/misc/rasterization_demo`.
2893
2894 Parameters
2895 ----------
2896 z : float or None
2897 The zorder below which artists are rasterized.
2898 If ``None`` rasterization based on zorder is deactivated.
2899 """
2900 self._rasterization_zorder = z
2901 self.stale = True
2902
2903 def get_rasterization_zorder(self):
2904 """Return the zorder value below which artists will be rasterized."""
2905 return self._rasterization_zorder

2907 def autoscale(self, enable=True, axis='both', tight=None):
2908 """
2909 Autoscale the axis view to the data (toggle).
2910
2911 Convenience method for simple axis view autoscaling.
2912 It turns autoscaling on or off, and then,
2913 if autoscaling for either axis is on, it performs
2914 the autoscaling on the specified axis or Axes.
2915
2916 Parameters
2917 ----------
2918 enable : bool or None, default: True
2919 True turns autoscaling on, False turns it off.
2920 None leaves the autoscaling state unchanged.
2921 axis : {'both', 'x', 'y'}, default: 'both'
2922 The axis on which to operate. (For 3D Axes, *axis* can also be set
2923 to 'z', and 'both' refers to all three Axes.)
2924 tight : bool or None, default: None
2925 If True, first set the margins to zero. Then, this argument is
2926 forwarded to `~.axes.Axes.autoscale_view` (regardless of
2927 its value); see the description of its behavior there.
2928 """
2929 if enable is None:
2930 scalex = True
2931 scaley = True
2932 else:
2933 if axis in ['x', 'both']:
2934 self.set_autoscalex_on(bool(enable))
2935 scalex = self.get_autoscalex_on()
2936 else:
2937 scalex = False
2938 if axis in ['y', 'both']:
2939 self.set_autoscaley_on(bool(enable))
2940 scaley = self.get_autoscaley_on()
2941 else:
2942 scaley = False
2943 if tight and scalex:
2944 self._xmargin = 0
2945 if tight and scaley:
2946 self._ymargin = 0
2947 if scalex:
2948 self._request_autoscale_view("x", tight=tight)
2949 if scaley:
2950 self._request_autoscale_view("y", tight=tight)
2951
2952 def autoscale_view(self, tight=None, scalex=True, scaley=True):
2953 """
2954 Autoscale the view limits using the data limits.
2955
2956 Parameters
2957 ----------
2958 tight : bool or None
2959 If *True*, only expand the axis limits using the margins. Note
2960 that unlike for `autoscale`, ``tight=True`` does *not* set the
2961 margins to zero.
2962
2963 If *False* and :rc:`axes.autolimit_mode` is 'round_numbers', then
2964 after expansion by the margins, further expand the axis limits
2965 using the axis major locator.
2966
2967 If None (the default), reuse the value set in the previous call to
2968 `autoscale_view` (the initial value is False, but the default style
2969 sets :rc:`axes.autolimit_mode` to 'data', in which case this
2970 behaves like True).
2971
2972 scalex : bool, default: True
2973 Whether to autoscale the x-axis.
2974
2975 scaley : bool, default: True
2976 Whether to autoscale the y-axis.
2977
2978 Notes
2979 -----
2980 The autoscaling preserves any preexisting axis direction reversal.
2981
2982 The data limits are not updated automatically when artist data are
2983 changed after the artist has been added to an Axes instance. In that
2984 case, use :meth:`matplotlib.axes.Axes.relim` prior to calling
2985 autoscale_view.
2986
2987 If the views of the Axes are fixed, e.g. via `set_xlim`, they will
2988 not be changed by autoscale_view().
2989 See :meth:`matplotlib.axes.Axes.autoscale` for an alternative.
2990 """
2991 if tight is not None:
2992 self._tight = bool(tight)
2993
2994 x_stickies = y_stickies = np.array([])
2995 if self.use_sticky_edges:
2996 if self._xmargin and scalex and self.get_autoscalex_on():
2997 x_stickies = np.sort(np.concatenate([
2998 artist.sticky_edges.x
2999 for ax in self._shared_axes["x"].get_siblings(self)
3000 for artist in ax.get_children()]))
3001 if self._ymargin and scaley and self.get_autoscaley_on():
3002 y_stickies = np.sort(np.concatenate([
3003 artist.sticky_edges.y
3004 for ax in self._shared_axes["y"].get_siblings(self)
3005 for artist in ax.get_children()]))
3006 if self.get_xscale() == 'log':
3007 x_stickies = x_stickies[x_stickies > 0]
3008 if self.get_yscale() == 'log':
3009 y_stickies = y_stickies[y_stickies > 0]
3010
3011 def handle_single_axis(
3012 scale, shared_axes, name, axis, margin, stickies, set_bound):
3013
3014 if not (scale and axis._get_autoscale_on()):
3015 return # nothing to do...
3016
3017 shared = shared_axes.get_siblings(self)
3018 # Base autoscaling on finite data limits when there is at least one
3019 # finite data limit among all the shared_axes and intervals.
3020 values = [val for ax in shared
3021 for val in getattr(ax.dataLim, f"interval{name}")
3022 if np.isfinite(val)]
3023 if values:
3024 x0, x1 = (min(values), max(values))
3025 elif getattr(self._viewLim, f"mutated{name}")():
3026 # No data, but explicit viewLims already set:
3027 # in mutatedx or mutatedy.
3028 return
3029 else:
3030 x0, x1 = (-np.inf, np.inf)
3031 # If x0 and x1 are nonfinite, get default limits from the locator.
3032 locator = axis.get_major_locator()
3033 x0, x1 = locator.nonsingular(x0, x1)
3034 # Find the minimum minpos for use in the margin calculation.
3035 minimum_minpos = min(
3036 getattr(ax.dataLim, f"minpos{name}") for ax in shared)
3037
3038 # Prevent margin addition from crossing a sticky value. A small
3039 # tolerance must be added due to floating point issues with
3040 # streamplot; it is defined relative to x1-x0 but has
3041 # no absolute term (e.g. "+1e-8") to avoid issues when working with
3042 # datasets where all values are tiny (less than 1e-8).
3043 tol = 1e-5 * abs(x1 - x0)
3044 # Index of largest element < x0 + tol, if any.
3045 i0 = stickies.searchsorted(x0 + tol) - 1
3046 x0bound = stickies[i0] if i0 != -1 else None
3047 # Index of smallest element > x1 - tol, if any.
3048 i1 = stickies.searchsorted(x1 - tol)
3049 x1bound = stickies[i1] if i1 != len(stickies) else None
3050
3051 # Add the margin in figure space and then transform back, to handle
3052 # non-linear scales.
3053 transform = axis.get_transform()
3054 inverse_trans = transform.inverted()
3055 x0, x1 = axis._scale.limit_range_for_scale(x0, x1, minimum_minpos)
3056 x0t, x1t = transform.transform([x0, x1])
3057 delta = (x1t - x0t) * margin
3058 if not np.isfinite(delta):
3059 delta = 0 # If a bound isn't finite, set margin to zero.
3060 x0, x1 = inverse_trans.transform([x0t - delta, x1t + delta])
3061
3062 # Apply sticky bounds.
3063 if x0bound is not None:
3064 x0 = max(x0, x0bound)
3065 if x1bound is not None:
3066 x1 = min(x1, x1bound)
3067
3068 if not self._tight:
3069 x0, x1 = locator.view_limits(x0, x1)
3070 set_bound(x0, x1)
3071 # End of definition of internal function 'handle_single_axis'.
3072
3073 handle_single_axis(
3074 scalex, self._shared_axes["x"], 'x', self.xaxis, self._xmargin,
3075 x_stickies, self.set_xbound)
3076 handle_single_axis(
3077 scaley, self._shared_axes["y"], 'y', self.yaxis, self._ymargin,
3078 y_stickies, self.set_ybound)
3079
3080 def _update_title_position(self, renderer):
3081 """
3082 Update the title position based on the bounding box enclosing
3083 all the ticklabels and x-axis spine and xlabel...
3084 """
3085 if self._autotitlepos is not None and not self._autotitlepos:
3086 _log.debug('title position was updated manually, not adjusting')
3087 return
3088
3089 titles = (self.title, self._left_title, self._right_title)
3090
3091 if not any(title.get_text() for title in titles):
3092 # If the titles are all empty, there is no need to update their positions.
3093 return
3094
3095 # Need to check all our twins too, aligned axes, and all the children
3096 # as well.
3097 axs = set()
3098 axs.update(self.child_axes)
3099 axs.update(self._twinned_axes.get_siblings(self))
3100 axs.update(
3101 self.get_figure(root=False)._align_label_groups['title'].get_siblings(self))
3102
3103 for ax in self.child_axes: # Child positions must be updated first.
3104 locator = ax.get_axes_locator()
3105 ax.apply_aspect(locator(self, renderer) if locator else None)
3106
3107 top = -np.inf
3108 for ax in axs:
3109 bb = None
3110 if (ax.xaxis.get_ticks_position() in ['top', 'unknown'] or
3111 ax.xaxis.get_label_position() == 'top'):
3112 bb = ax.xaxis.get_tightbbox(renderer)
3113 if bb is None:
3114 # Extent of the outline for colorbars, of the axes otherwise.
3115 bb = ax.spines.get("outline", ax).get_window_extent()
3116 top = max(top, bb.ymax)
3117
3118 for title in titles:
3119 x, _ = title.get_position()
3120 # need to start again in case of window resizing
3121 title.set_position((x, 1.0))
3122 if title.get_text():
3123 for ax in axs:
3124 ax.yaxis.get_tightbbox(renderer) # update offsetText
3125 if ax.yaxis.offsetText.get_text():
3126 bb = ax.yaxis.offsetText.get_tightbbox(renderer)
3127 if bb.intersection(title.get_tightbbox(renderer), bb):
3128 top = bb.ymax
3129 if top < 0:
3130 # the top of Axes is not even on the figure, so don't try and
3131 # automatically place it.
3132 _log.debug('top of Axes not in the figure, so title not moved')
3133 return
3134 if title.get_window_extent(renderer).ymin < top:
3135 _, y = self.transAxes.inverted().transform((0, top))
3136 title.set_position((x, y))
3137 # empirically, this doesn't always get the min to top,
3138 # so we need to adjust again.
3139 if title.get_window_extent(renderer).ymin < top:
3140 _, y = self.transAxes.inverted().transform(
3141 (0., 2 * top - title.get_window_extent(renderer).ymin))
3142 title.set_position((x, y))
3143
3144 ymax = max(title.get_position()[1] for title in titles)
3145 for title in titles:
3146 # now line up all the titles at the highest baseline.
3147 x, _ = title.get_position()
3148 title.set_position((x, ymax))
3149
3150 # Drawing
3151 @martist.allow_rasterization
3152 def draw(self, renderer):
3153 # docstring inherited
3154 if renderer is None:
3155 raise RuntimeError('No renderer defined')
3156 if not self.get_visible():
3157 return
3158 self._unstale_viewLim()
3159
3160 renderer.open_group('axes', gid=self.get_gid())
3161
3162 # prevent triggering call backs during the draw process
3163 self._stale = True
3164
3165 # loop over self and child Axes...
3166 locator = self.get_axes_locator()
3167 self.apply_aspect(locator(self, renderer) if locator else None)
3168
3169 artists = self.get_children()
3170 artists.remove(self.patch)
3171
3172 # the frame draws the edges around the Axes patch -- we
3173 # decouple these so the patch can be in the background and the
3174 # frame in the foreground. Do this before drawing the axis
3175 # objects so that the spine has the opportunity to update them.
3176 if not (self.axison and self._frameon):
3177 for spine in self.spines.values():
3178 artists.remove(spine)
3179
3180 self._update_title_position(renderer)
3181
3182 if not self.axison:
3183 for _axis in self._axis_map.values():
3184 artists.remove(_axis)
3185
3186 if not self.get_figure(root=True).canvas.is_saving():
3187 artists = [
3188 a for a in artists
3189 if not a.get_animated() or isinstance(a, mimage.AxesImage)]
3190 artists = sorted(artists, key=attrgetter('zorder'))
3191
3192 # rasterize artists with negative zorder
3193 # if the minimum zorder is negative, start rasterization
3194 rasterization_zorder = self._rasterization_zorder
3195
3196 if (rasterization_zorder is not None and
3197 artists and artists[0].zorder < rasterization_zorder):
3198 split_index = np.searchsorted(
3199 [art.zorder for art in artists],
3200 rasterization_zorder, side='right'
3201 )
3202 artists_rasterized = artists[:split_index]
3203 artists = artists[split_index:]
3204 else:
3205 artists_rasterized = []
3206
3207 if self.axison and self._frameon:
3208 if artists_rasterized:
3209 artists_rasterized = [self.patch] + artists_rasterized
3210 else:
3211 artists = [self.patch] + artists
3212
3213 if artists_rasterized:
3214 _draw_rasterized(self.get_figure(root=True), artists_rasterized, renderer)
3215
3216 mimage._draw_list_compositing_images(
3217 renderer, self, artists, self.get_figure(root=True).suppressComposite)
3218
3219 renderer.close_group('axes')
3220 self.stale = False
3221
3222 def draw_artist(self, a):
3223 """
3224 Efficiently redraw a single artist.
3225 """
3226 a.draw(self.get_figure(root=True).canvas.get_renderer())
3227
3228 def redraw_in_frame(self):
3229 """
3230 Efficiently redraw Axes data, but not axis ticks, labels, etc.
3231 """
3232 with ExitStack() as stack:
3233 for artist in [*self._axis_map.values(),
3234 self.title, self._left_title, self._right_title]:
3235 stack.enter_context(artist._cm_set(visible=False))
3236 self.draw(self.get_figure(root=True).canvas.get_renderer())

3255 def get_axisbelow(self):
3256 """
3257 Get whether axis ticks and gridlines are above or below most artists.
3258
3259 Returns
3260 -------
3261 bool or 'line'
3262
3263 See Also
3264 --------
3265 set_axisbelow
3266 """
3267 return self._axisbelow
3268
3269 def set_axisbelow(self, b):
3270 """
3271 Set whether axis ticks and gridlines are above or below most artists.
3272
3273 This controls the zorder of the ticks and gridlines. For more
3274 information on the zorder see :doc:`/gallery/misc/zorder_demo`.
3275
3276 Parameters
3277 ----------
3278 b : bool or 'line'
3279 Possible values:
3280
3281 - *True* (zorder = 0.5): Ticks and gridlines are below patches and
3282 lines, though still above images.
3283 - 'line' (zorder = 1.5): Ticks and gridlines are above patches
3284 (e.g. rectangles, with default zorder = 1) but still below lines
3285 and markers (with their default zorder = 2).
3286 - *False* (zorder = 2.5): Ticks and gridlines are above patches
3287 and lines / markers.
3288
3289 Notes
3290 -----
3291 For more control, call the `~.Artist.set_zorder` method of each axis.
3292
3293 See Also
3294 --------
3295 get_axisbelow
3296 """
3297 # Check that b is True, False or 'line'
3298 self._axisbelow = axisbelow = validate_axisbelow(b)
3299 zorder = {
3300 True: 0.5,
3301 'line': 1.5,
3302 False: 2.5,
3303 }[axisbelow]
3304 for axis in self._axis_map.values():
3305 axis.set_zorder(zorder)
3306 self.stale = True

3308 @_docstring.interpd
3309 def grid(self, visible=None, which='major', axis='both', **kwargs):
3310 """
3311 Configure the grid lines.
3312
3313 Parameters
3314 ----------
3315 visible : bool or None, optional
3316 Whether to show the grid lines. If any *kwargs* are supplied, it
3317 is assumed you want the grid on and *visible* will be set to True.
3318
3319 If *visible* is *None* and there are no *kwargs*, this toggles the
3320 visibility of the lines.
3321
3322 which : {'major', 'minor', 'both'}, optional
3323 The grid lines to apply the changes on.
3324
3325 axis : {'both', 'x', 'y'}, optional
3326 The axis to apply the changes on.
3327
3328 **kwargs : `~matplotlib.lines.Line2D` properties
3329 Define the line properties of the grid, e.g.::
3330
3331 grid(color='r', linestyle='-', linewidth=2)
3332
3333 Valid keyword arguments are:
3334
3335 %(Line2D:kwdoc)s
3336
3337 Notes
3338 -----
3339 The axis is drawn as a unit, so the effective zorder for drawing the
3340 grid is determined by the zorder of each axis, not by the zorder of the
3341 `.Line2D` objects comprising the grid. Therefore, to set grid zorder,
3342 use `.set_axisbelow` or, for more control, call the
3343 `~.Artist.set_zorder` method of each axis.
3344 """
3345 _api.check_in_list(['x', 'y', 'both'], axis=axis)
3346 if axis in ['x', 'both']:
3347 self.xaxis.grid(visible, which=which, **kwargs)
3348 if axis in ['y', 'both']:
3349 self.yaxis.grid(visible, which=which, **kwargs)

3351 def ticklabel_format(self, *, axis='both', style=None, scilimits=None,
3352 useOffset=None, useLocale=None, useMathText=None):
3353 r"""
3354 Configure the `.ScalarFormatter` used by default for linear Axes.
3355
3356 If a parameter is not set, the corresponding property of the formatter
3357 is left unchanged.
3358
3359 Parameters
3360 ----------
3361 axis : {'x', 'y', 'both'}, default: 'both'
3362 The axis to configure. Only major ticks are affected.
3363
3364 style : {'sci', 'scientific', 'plain'}
3365 Whether to use scientific notation.
3366 The formatter default is to use scientific notation.
3367 'sci' is equivalent to 'scientific'.
3368
3369 scilimits : pair of ints (m, n)
3370 Scientific notation is used only for numbers outside the range
3371 10\ :sup:`m` to 10\ :sup:`n` (and only if the formatter is
3372 configured to use scientific notation at all). Use (0, 0) to
3373 include all numbers. Use (m, m) where m != 0 to fix the order of
3374 magnitude to 10\ :sup:`m`.
3375 The formatter default is :rc:`axes.formatter.limits`.
3376
3377 useOffset : bool or float
3378 If True, the offset is calculated as needed.
3379 If False, no offset is used.
3380 If a numeric value, it sets the offset.
3381 The formatter default is :rc:`axes.formatter.useoffset`.
3382
3383 useLocale : bool
3384 Whether to format the number using the current locale or using the
3385 C (English) locale. This affects e.g. the decimal separator. The
3386 formatter default is :rc:`axes.formatter.use_locale`.
3387
3388 useMathText : bool
3389 Render the offset and scientific notation in mathtext.
3390 The formatter default is :rc:`axes.formatter.use_mathtext`.
3391
3392 Raises
3393 ------
3394 AttributeError
3395 If the current formatter is not a `.ScalarFormatter`.
3396 """
3397 if isinstance(style, str):
3398 style = style.lower()
3399 axis = axis.lower()
3400 if scilimits is not None:
3401 try:
3402 m, n = scilimits
3403 m + n + 1 # check that both are numbers
3404 except (ValueError, TypeError) as err:
3405 raise ValueError("scilimits must be a sequence of 2 integers"
3406 ) from err
3407 STYLES = {'sci': True, 'scientific': True, 'plain': False, '': None, None: None}
3408 # The '' option is included for backwards-compatibility.
3409 is_sci_style = _api.check_getitem(STYLES, style=style)
3410 axis_map = {**{k: [v] for k, v in self._axis_map.items()},
3411 'both': list(self._axis_map.values())}
3412 axises = _api.check_getitem(axis_map, axis=axis)
3413 try:
3414 for axis in axises:
3415 if is_sci_style is not None:
3416 axis.major.formatter.set_scientific(is_sci_style)
3417 if scilimits is not None:
3418 axis.major.formatter.set_powerlimits(scilimits)
3419 if useOffset is not None:
3420 axis.major.formatter.set_useOffset(useOffset)
3421 if useLocale is not None:
3422 axis.major.formatter.set_useLocale(useLocale)
3423 if useMathText is not None:
3424 axis.major.formatter.set_useMathText(useMathText)
3425 except AttributeError as err:
3426 raise AttributeError(
3427 "This method only works with the ScalarFormatter") from err

3429 def locator_params(self, axis='both', tight=None, **kwargs):
3430 """
3431 Control behavior of major tick locators.
3432
3433 Because the locator is involved in autoscaling, `~.Axes.autoscale_view`
3434 is called automatically after the parameters are changed.
3435
3436 Parameters
3437 ----------
3438 axis : {'both', 'x', 'y'}, default: 'both'
3439 The axis on which to operate. (For 3D Axes, *axis* can also be
3440 set to 'z', and 'both' refers to all three axes.)
3441 tight : bool or None, optional
3442 Parameter passed to `~.Axes.autoscale_view`.
3443 Default is None, for no change.
3444
3445 Other Parameters
3446 ----------------
3447 **kwargs
3448 Remaining keyword arguments are passed to directly to the
3449 ``set_params()`` method of the locator. Supported keywords depend
3450 on the type of the locator. See for example
3451 `~.ticker.MaxNLocator.set_params` for the `.ticker.MaxNLocator`
3452 used by default for linear.
3453
3454 Examples
3455 --------
3456 When plotting small subplots, one might want to reduce the maximum
3457 number of ticks and use tight bounds, for example::
3458
3459 ax.locator_params(tight=True, nbins=4)
3460
3461 """
3462 _api.check_in_list([*self._axis_names, "both"], axis=axis)
3463 for name in self._axis_names:
3464 if axis in [name, "both"]:
3465 loc = self._axis_map[name].get_major_locator()
3466 loc.set_params(**kwargs)
3467 self._request_autoscale_view(name, tight=tight)
3468 self.stale = True
3469
3470 def tick_params(self, axis='both', **kwargs):
3471 """
3472 Change the appearance of ticks, tick labels, and gridlines.
3473
3474 Tick properties that are not explicitly set using the keyword
3475 arguments remain unchanged unless *reset* is True. For the current
3476 style settings, see `.Axis.get_tick_params`.
3477
3478 Parameters
3479 ----------
3480 axis : {'x', 'y', 'both'}, default: 'both'
3481 The axis to which the parameters are applied.
3482 which : {'major', 'minor', 'both'}, default: 'major'
3483 The group of ticks to which the parameters are applied.
3484 reset : bool, default: False
3485 Whether to reset the ticks to defaults before updating them.
3486
3487 Other Parameters
3488 ----------------
3489 direction : {'in', 'out', 'inout'}
3490 Puts ticks inside the Axes, outside the Axes, or both.
3491 length : float
3492 Tick length in points.
3493 width : float
3494 Tick width in points.
3495 color : :mpltype:`color`
3496 Tick color.
3497 pad : float
3498 Distance in points between tick and label.
3499 labelsize : float or str
3500 Tick label font size in points or as a string (e.g., 'large').
3501 labelcolor : :mpltype:`color`
3502 Tick label color.
3503 labelfontfamily : str
3504 Tick label font.
3505 colors : :mpltype:`color`
3506 Tick color and label color.
3507 zorder : float
3508 Tick and label zorder.
3509 bottom, top, left, right : bool
3510 Whether to draw the respective ticks.
3511 labelbottom, labeltop, labelleft, labelright : bool
3512 Whether to draw the respective tick labels.
3513 labelrotation : float
3514 Tick label rotation
3515 grid_color : :mpltype:`color`
3516 Gridline color.
3517 grid_alpha : float
3518 Transparency of gridlines: 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque).
3519 grid_linewidth : float
3520 Width of gridlines in points.
3521 grid_linestyle : str
3522 Any valid `.Line2D` line style spec.
3523
3524 Examples
3525 --------
3526 ::
3527
3528 ax.tick_params(direction='out', length=6, width=2, colors='r',
3529 grid_color='r', grid_alpha=0.5)
3530
3531 This will make all major ticks be red, pointing out of the box,
3532 and with dimensions 6 points by 2 points. Tick labels will
3533 also be red. Gridlines will be red and translucent.
3534
3535 """
3536 _api.check_in_list(['x', 'y', 'both'], axis=axis)
3537 if axis in ['x', 'both']:
3538 xkw = dict(kwargs)
3539 xkw.pop('left', None)
3540 xkw.pop('right', None)
3541 xkw.pop('labelleft', None)
3542 xkw.pop('labelright', None)
3543 self.xaxis.set_tick_params(**xkw)
3544 if axis in ['y', 'both']:
3545 ykw = dict(kwargs)
3546 ykw.pop('top', None)
3547 ykw.pop('bottom', None)
3548 ykw.pop('labeltop', None)
3549 ykw.pop('labelbottom', None)
3550 self.yaxis.set_tick_params(**ykw)

3552 def set_axis_off(self):
3553 """
3554 Hide all visual components of the x- and y-axis.
3555
3556 This sets a flag to suppress drawing of all axis decorations, i.e.
3557 axis labels, axis spines, and the axis tick component (tick markers,
3558 tick labels, and grid lines). Individual visibility settings of these
3559 components are ignored as long as `set_axis_off()` is in effect.
3560 """
3561 self.axison = False
3562 self.stale = True
3563
3564 def set_axis_on(self):
3565 """
3566 Do not hide all visual components of the x- and y-axis.
3567
3568 This reverts the effect of a prior `.set_axis_off()` call. Whether the
3569 individual axis decorations are drawn is controlled by their respective
3570 visibility settings.
3571
3572 This is on by default.
3573 """
3574 self.axison = True
3575 self.stale = True

3586 def set_xlabel(self, xlabel, fontdict=None, labelpad=None, *,

3589 Set the label for the x-axis.
3590
3591 Parameters
3592 ----------
3593 xlabel : str
3594 The label text.
3595
3596 labelpad : float, default: :rc:`axes.labelpad`
3597 Spacing in points from the Axes bounding box including ticks
3598 and tick labels. If None, the previous value is left as is.
3599
3600 loc : {'left', 'center', 'right'}, default: :rc:`xaxis.labellocation`
3601 The label position. This is a high-level alternative for passing
3602 parameters *x* and *horizontalalignment*.

3607 `.Text` properties control the appearance of the label.
3608

3610 --------
3611 text : Documents the properties supported by `.Text`.
3612 """
3613 if labelpad is not None:
3614 self.xaxis.labelpad = labelpad
3615 protected_kw = ['x', 'horizontalalignment', 'ha']
3616 if {*kwargs} & {*protected_kw}:
3617 if loc is not None:
3618 raise TypeError(f"Specifying 'loc' is disallowed when any of "
3619 f"its corresponding low level keyword "
3620 f"arguments ({protected_kw}) are also "
3621 f"supplied")
3622
3623 else:
3624 loc = (loc if loc is not None
3625 else mpl.rcParams['xaxis.labellocation'])
3626 _api.check_in_list(('left', 'center', 'right'), loc=loc)
3627
3628 x = {
3629 'left': 0,
3630 'center': 0.5,
3631 'right': 1,
3632 }[loc]
3633 kwargs.update(x=x, horizontalalignment=loc)

3651 def get_xbound(self):
3652 """
3653 Return the lower and upper x-axis bounds, in increasing order.
3654
3655 See Also
3656 --------
3657 set_xbound
3658 get_xlim, set_xlim
3659 invert_xaxis, xaxis_inverted
3660 """
3661 left, right = self.get_xlim()
3662 if left < right:
3663 return left, right
3664 else:
3665 return right, left

3667 def set_xbound(self, lower=None, upper=None):
3668 """
3669 Set the lower and upper numerical bounds of the x-axis.
3670
3671 This method will honor axis inversion regardless of parameter order.
3672 It will not change the autoscaling setting (`.get_autoscalex_on()`).
3673
3674 Parameters
3675 ----------
3676 lower, upper : float or None
3677 The lower and upper bounds. If *None*, the respective axis bound
3678 is not modified.
3679
3680 .. ACCEPTS: (lower: float, upper: float)
3681
3682 See Also
3683 --------
3684 get_xbound
3685 get_xlim, set_xlim
3686 invert_xaxis, xaxis_inverted
3687 """
3688 if upper is None and np.iterable(lower):
3689 lower, upper = lower
3690
3691 old_lower, old_upper = self.get_xbound()
3692 if lower is None:
3693 lower = old_lower
3694 if upper is None:
3695 upper = old_upper
3696
3697 self.set_xlim(sorted((lower, upper),
3698 reverse=bool(self.xaxis_inverted())),
3699 auto=None)

3701 def get_xlim(self):
3702 """
3703 Return the x-axis view limits.
3704
3705 Returns
3706 -------
3707 left, right : (float, float)
3708 The current x-axis limits in data coordinates.
3709
3710 See Also
3711 --------
3712 .Axes.set_xlim
3713 .Axes.set_xbound, .Axes.get_xbound
3714 .Axes.invert_xaxis, .Axes.xaxis_inverted
3715
3716 Notes
3717 -----
3718 The x-axis may be inverted, in which case the *left* value will
3719 be greater than the *right* value.
3720 """
3721 return tuple(self.viewLim.intervalx)

3723 def _validate_converted_limits(self, limit, convert):
3724 """
3725 Raise ValueError if converted limits are non-finite.
3726
3727 Note that this function also accepts None as a limit argument.
3728
3729 Returns
3730 -------
3731 The limit value after call to convert(), or None if limit is None.
3732 """
3733 if limit is not None:
3734 converted_limit = convert(limit)
3735 if isinstance(converted_limit, np.ndarray):
3736 converted_limit = converted_limit.squeeze()
3737 if (isinstance(converted_limit, Real)
3738 and not np.isfinite(converted_limit)):
3739 raise ValueError("Axis limits cannot be NaN or Inf")
3740 return converted_limit
3741
3742 def set_xlim(self, left=None, right=None, *, emit=True, auto=False,
3743 xmin=None, xmax=None):
3744 """
3745 Set the x-axis view limits.
3746
3747 Parameters
3748 ----------
3749 left : float, optional
3750 The left xlim in data coordinates. Passing *None* leaves the
3751 limit unchanged.
3752
3753 The left and right xlims may also be passed as the tuple
3754 (*left*, *right*) as the first positional argument (or as
3755 the *left* keyword argument).
3756
3757 .. ACCEPTS: (left: float, right: float)
3758
3759 right : float, optional
3760 The right xlim in data coordinates. Passing *None* leaves the
3761 limit unchanged.
3762
3763 emit : bool, default: True
3764 Whether to notify observers of limit change.
3765
3766 auto : bool or None, default: False
3767 Whether to turn on autoscaling of the x-axis. True turns on,
3768 False turns off, None leaves unchanged.
3769
3770 xmin, xmax : float, optional
3771 They are equivalent to left and right respectively, and it is an
3772 error to pass both *xmin* and *left* or *xmax* and *right*.
3773
3774 Returns
3775 -------
3776 left, right : (float, float)
3777 The new x-axis limits in data coordinates.
3778
3779 See Also
3780 --------
3781 get_xlim
3782 set_xbound, get_xbound
3783 invert_xaxis, xaxis_inverted
3784
3785 Notes
3786 -----
3787 The *left* value may be greater than the *right* value, in which
3788 case the x-axis values will decrease from left to right.
3789
3790 Examples
3791 --------
3792 >>> set_xlim(left, right)
3793 >>> set_xlim((left, right))
3794 >>> left, right = set_xlim(left, right)
3795
3796 One limit may be left unchanged.
3797
3798 >>> set_xlim(right=right_lim)
3799
3800 Limits may be passed in reverse order to flip the direction of
3801 the x-axis. For example, suppose *x* represents the number of
3802 years before present. The x-axis limits might be set like the
3803 following so 5000 years ago is on the left of the plot and the
3804 present is on the right.
3805
3806 >>> set_xlim(5000, 0)
3807 """
3808 if right is None and np.iterable(left):
3809 left, right = left
3810 if xmin is not None:
3811 if left is not None:
3812 raise TypeError("Cannot pass both 'left' and 'xmin'")
3813 left = xmin
3814 if xmax is not None:
3815 if right is not None:
3816 raise TypeError("Cannot pass both 'right' and 'xmax'")
3817 right = xmax
3818 return self.xaxis._set_lim(left, right, emit=emit, auto=auto)

3920 def set_ybound(self, lower=None, upper=None):
3921 """
3922 Set the lower and upper numerical bounds of the y-axis.
3923
3924 This method will honor axis inversion regardless of parameter order.
3925 It will not change the autoscaling setting (`.get_autoscaley_on()`).
3926
3927 Parameters
3928 ----------
3929 lower, upper : float or None
3930 The lower and upper bounds. If *None*, the respective axis bound
3931 is not modified.
3932
3933 .. ACCEPTS: (lower: float, upper: float)
3934
3935 See Also
3936 --------
3937 get_ybound
3938 get_ylim, set_ylim
3939 invert_yaxis, yaxis_inverted
3940 """
3941 if upper is None and np.iterable(lower):
3942 lower, upper = lower
3943
3944 old_lower, old_upper = self.get_ybound()
3945 if lower is None:
3946 lower = old_lower
3947 if upper is None:
3948 upper = old_upper
3949
3950 self.set_ylim(sorted((lower, upper),
3951 reverse=bool(self.yaxis_inverted())),
3952 auto=None)
3953
3954 def get_ylim(self):
3955 """
3956 Return the y-axis view limits.
3957
3958 Returns
3959 -------
3960 bottom, top : (float, float)
3961 The current y-axis limits in data coordinates.
3962
3963 See Also
3964 --------
3965 .Axes.set_ylim
3966 .Axes.set_ybound, .Axes.get_ybound
3967 .Axes.invert_yaxis, .Axes.yaxis_inverted
3968
3969 Notes
3970 -----
3971 The y-axis may be inverted, in which case the *bottom* value
3972 will be greater than the *top* value.
3973 """
3974 return tuple(self.viewLim.intervaly)
3975
3976 def set_ylim(self, bottom=None, top=None, *, emit=True, auto=False,
3977 ymin=None, ymax=None):
3978 """
3979 Set the y-axis view limits.
3980
3981 Parameters
3982 ----------
3983 bottom : float, optional
3984 The bottom ylim in data coordinates. Passing *None* leaves the
3985 limit unchanged.
3986
3987 The bottom and top ylims may also be passed as the tuple
3988 (*bottom*, *top*) as the first positional argument (or as
3989 the *bottom* keyword argument).
3990
3991 .. ACCEPTS: (bottom: float, top: float)
3992
3993 top : float, optional
3994 The top ylim in data coordinates. Passing *None* leaves the
3995 limit unchanged.
3996
3997 emit : bool, default: True
3998 Whether to notify observers of limit change.
3999
4000 auto : bool or None, default: False
4001 Whether to turn on autoscaling of the y-axis. *True* turns on,
4002 *False* turns off, *None* leaves unchanged.
4003
4004 ymin, ymax : float, optional
4005 They are equivalent to bottom and top respectively, and it is an
4006 error to pass both *ymin* and *bottom* or *ymax* and *top*.
4007
4008 Returns
4009 -------
4010 bottom, top : (float, float)
4011 The new y-axis limits in data coordinates.
4012
4013 See Also
4014 --------
4015 get_ylim
4016 set_ybound, get_ybound
4017 invert_yaxis, yaxis_inverted
4018
4019 Notes
4020 -----
4021 The *bottom* value may be greater than the *top* value, in which
4022 case the y-axis values will decrease from *bottom* to *top*.
4023
4024 Examples
4025 --------
4026 >>> set_ylim(bottom, top)
4027 >>> set_ylim((bottom, top))
4028 >>> bottom, top = set_ylim(bottom, top)
4029
4030 One limit may be left unchanged.
4031
4032 >>> set_ylim(top=top_lim)
4033
4034 Limits may be passed in reverse order to flip the direction of
4035 the y-axis. For example, suppose ``y`` represents depth of the
4036 ocean in m. The y-axis limits might be set like the following
4037 so 5000 m depth is at the bottom of the plot and the surface,
4038 0 m, is at the top.
4039
4040 >>> set_ylim(5000, 0)
4041 """
4042 if top is None and np.iterable(bottom):
4043 bottom, top = bottom
4044 if ymin is not None:
4045 if bottom is not None:
4046 raise TypeError("Cannot pass both 'bottom' and 'ymin'")
4047 bottom = ymin
4048 if ymax is not None:
4049 if top is not None:
4050 raise TypeError("Cannot pass both 'top' and 'ymax'")
4051 top = ymax
4052 return self.yaxis._set_lim(bottom, top, emit=emit, auto=auto)
4053

4057 set_yticks = _axis_method_wrapper("yaxis", "set_ticks",

4061 get_yticklabels = _axis_method_wrapper("yaxis", "get_ticklabels")
4062 set_yticklabels = _axis_method_wrapper(
4063 "yaxis", "set_ticklabels",
4064 doc_sub={"Axis.set_ticks": "Axes.set_yticks"})

4069 def format_xdata(self, x):
4070 """
4071 Return *x* formatted as an x-value.
4072
4073 This function will use the `.fmt_xdata` attribute if it is not None,
4074 else will fall back on the xaxis major formatter.
4075 """
4076 return (self.fmt_xdata if self.fmt_xdata is not None
4077 else self.xaxis.get_major_formatter().format_data_short)(x)

4079 def format_ydata(self, y):
4080 """
4081 Return *y* formatted as a y-value.
4082
4083 This function will use the `.fmt_ydata` attribute if it is not None,
4084 else will fall back on the yaxis major formatter.
4085 """
4086 return (self.fmt_ydata if self.fmt_ydata is not None
4087 else self.yaxis.get_major_formatter().format_data_short)(y)
4088
4089 def format_coord(self, x, y):
4090 """Return a format string formatting the *x*, *y* coordinates."""
4091 twins = self._twinned_axes.get_siblings(self)
4092 if len(twins) == 1:
4093 return "(x, y) = ({}, {})".format(
4094 "???" if x is None else self.format_xdata(x),
4095 "???" if y is None else self.format_ydata(y))
4096 screen_xy = self.transData.transform((x, y))
4097 xy_strs = []
4098 # Retrieve twins in the order of self.figure.axes to sort tied zorders (which is
4099 # the common case) by the order in which they are added to the figure.
4100 for ax in sorted(twins, key=attrgetter("zorder")):
4101 data_x, data_y = ax.transData.inverted().transform(screen_xy)
4102 xy_strs.append(
4103 "({}, {})".format(ax.format_xdata(data_x), ax.format_ydata(data_y)))
4104 return "(x, y) = {}".format(" | ".join(xy_strs))

4172 def _get_view(self):
4173 """
4174 Save information required to reproduce the current view.
4175
4176 This method is called before a view is changed, such as during a pan or zoom
4177 initiated by the user. It returns an opaque object that describes the current
4178 view, in a format compatible with :meth:`_set_view`.
4179
4180 The default implementation saves the view limits and autoscaling state.
4181 Subclasses may override this as needed, as long as :meth:`_set_view` is also
4182 adjusted accordingly.
4183 """
4184 return {
4185 "xlim": self.get_xlim(), "autoscalex_on": self.get_autoscalex_on(),
4186 "ylim": self.get_ylim(), "autoscaley_on": self.get_autoscaley_on(),
4187 }
4188
4189 def _set_view(self, view):
4190 """
4191 Apply a previously saved view.
4192
4193 This method is called when restoring a view (with the return value of
4194 :meth:`_get_view` as argument), such as with the navigation buttons.
4195
4196 Subclasses that override :meth:`_get_view` also need to override this method
4197 accordingly.
4198 """
4199 self.set(**view)
4200
4201 def _prepare_view_from_bbox(self, bbox, direction='in',
4202 mode=None, twinx=False, twiny=False):
4203 """
4204 Helper function to prepare the new bounds from a bbox.
4205
4206 This helper function returns the new x and y bounds from the zoom
4207 bbox. This a convenience method to abstract the bbox logic
4208 out of the base setter.
4209 """
4210 if len(bbox) == 3:
4211 xp, yp, scl = bbox # Zooming code
4212 if scl == 0: # Should not happen
4213 scl = 1.
4214 if scl > 1:
4215 direction = 'in'
4216 else:
4217 direction = 'out'
4218 scl = 1/scl
4219 # get the limits of the axes
4220 (xmin, ymin), (xmax, ymax) = self.transData.transform(
4221 np.transpose([self.get_xlim(), self.get_ylim()]))
4222 # set the range
4223 xwidth = xmax - xmin
4224 ywidth = ymax - ymin
4225 xcen = (xmax + xmin)*.5
4226 ycen = (ymax + ymin)*.5
4227 xzc = (xp*(scl - 1) + xcen)/scl
4228 yzc = (yp*(scl - 1) + ycen)/scl
4229 bbox = [xzc - xwidth/2./scl, yzc - ywidth/2./scl,
4230 xzc + xwidth/2./scl, yzc + ywidth/2./scl]
4231 elif len(bbox) != 4:
4232 # should be len 3 or 4 but nothing else
4233 _api.warn_external(
4234 "Warning in _set_view_from_bbox: bounding box is not a tuple "
4235 "of length 3 or 4. Ignoring the view change.")
4236 return
4237
4238 # Original limits.
4239 xmin0, xmax0 = self.get_xbound()
4240 ymin0, ymax0 = self.get_ybound()
4241 # The zoom box in screen coords.
4242 startx, starty, stopx, stopy = bbox
4243 # Convert to data coords.
4244 (startx, starty), (stopx, stopy) = self.transData.inverted().transform(
4245 [(startx, starty), (stopx, stopy)])
4246 # Clip to axes limits.
4247 xmin, xmax = np.clip(sorted([startx, stopx]), xmin0, xmax0)
4248 ymin, ymax = np.clip(sorted([starty, stopy]), ymin0, ymax0)
4249 # Don't double-zoom twinned axes or if zooming only the other axis.
4250 if twinx or mode == "y":
4251 xmin, xmax = xmin0, xmax0
4252 if twiny or mode == "x":
4253 ymin, ymax = ymin0, ymax0
4254
4255 if direction == "in":
4256 new_xbound = xmin, xmax
4257 new_ybound = ymin, ymax
4258
4259 elif direction == "out":
4260 x_trf = self.xaxis.get_transform()
4261 sxmin0, sxmax0, sxmin, sxmax = x_trf.transform(
4262 [xmin0, xmax0, xmin, xmax]) # To screen space.
4263 factor = (sxmax0 - sxmin0) / (sxmax - sxmin) # Unzoom factor.
4264 # Move original bounds away by
4265 # (factor) x (distance between unzoom box and Axes bbox).
4266 sxmin1 = sxmin0 - factor * (sxmin - sxmin0)
4267 sxmax1 = sxmax0 + factor * (sxmax0 - sxmax)
4268 # And back to data space.
4269 new_xbound = x_trf.inverted().transform([sxmin1, sxmax1])
4270
4271 y_trf = self.yaxis.get_transform()
4272 symin0, symax0, symin, symax = y_trf.transform(
4273 [ymin0, ymax0, ymin, ymax])
4274 factor = (symax0 - symin0) / (symax - symin)
4275 symin1 = symin0 - factor * (symin - symin0)
4276 symax1 = symax0 + factor * (symax0 - symax)
4277 new_ybound = y_trf.inverted().transform([symin1, symax1])
4278
4279 return new_xbound, new_ybound
4280
4281 def _set_view_from_bbox(self, bbox, direction='in',
4282 mode=None, twinx=False, twiny=False):
4283 """
4284 Update view from a selection bbox.
4285
4286 .. note::
4287
4288 Intended to be overridden by new projection types, but if not, the
4289 default implementation sets the view limits to the bbox directly.
4290
4291 Parameters
4292 ----------
4293 bbox : 4-tuple or 3 tuple
4294 * If bbox is a 4 tuple, it is the selected bounding box limits,
4295 in *display* coordinates.
4296 * If bbox is a 3 tuple, it is an (xp, yp, scl) triple, where
4297 (xp, yp) is the center of zooming and scl the scale factor to
4298 zoom by.
4299
4300 direction : str
4301 The direction to apply the bounding box.
4302 * `'in'` - The bounding box describes the view directly, i.e.,
4303 it zooms in.
4304 * `'out'` - The bounding box describes the size to make the
4305 existing view, i.e., it zooms out.
4306
4307 mode : str or None
4308 The selection mode, whether to apply the bounding box in only the
4309 `'x'` direction, `'y'` direction or both (`None`).
4310
4311 twinx : bool
4312 Whether this axis is twinned in the *x*-direction.
4313
4314 twiny : bool
4315 Whether this axis is twinned in the *y*-direction.
4316 """
4317 new_xbound, new_ybound = self._prepare_view_from_bbox(
4318 bbox, direction=direction, mode=mode, twinx=twinx, twiny=twiny)
4319 if not twinx and mode != "y":
4320 self.set_xbound(new_xbound)
4321 self.set_autoscalex_on(False)
4322 if not twiny and mode != "x":
4323 self.set_ybound(new_ybound)
4324 self.set_autoscaley_on(False)
4325
4326 def start_pan(self, x, y, button):
4327 """
4328 Called when a pan operation has started.
4329
4330 Parameters
4331 ----------
4332 x, y : float
4333 The mouse coordinates in display coords.
4334 button : `.MouseButton`
4335 The pressed mouse button.
4336
4337 Notes
4338 -----
4339 This is intended to be overridden by new projection types.
4340 """
4341 self._pan_start = types.SimpleNamespace(
4342 lim=self.viewLim.frozen(),
4343 trans=self.transData.frozen(),
4344 trans_inverse=self.transData.inverted().frozen(),
4345 bbox=self.bbox.frozen(),
4346 x=x,
4347 y=y)
4348
4349 def end_pan(self):
4350 """
4351 Called when a pan operation completes (when the mouse button is up.)
4352
4353 Notes
4354 -----
4355 This is intended to be overridden by new projection types.
4356 """
4357 del self._pan_start

4359 def _get_pan_points(self, button, key, x, y):
4360 """
4361 Helper function to return the new points after a pan.
4362
4363 This helper function returns the points on the axis after a pan has
4364 occurred. This is a convenience method to abstract the pan logic
4365 out of the base setter.
4366 """
4367 def format_deltas(key, dx, dy):
4368 if key == 'control':
4369 if abs(dx) > abs(dy):
4370 dy = dx
4371 else:
4372 dx = dy
4373 elif key == 'x':
4374 dy = 0
4375 elif key == 'y':
4376 dx = 0
4377 elif key == 'shift':
4378 if 2 * abs(dx) < abs(dy):
4379 dx = 0
4380 elif 2 * abs(dy) < abs(dx):
4381 dy = 0
4382 elif abs(dx) > abs(dy):
4383 dy = dy / abs(dy) * abs(dx)
4384 else:
4385 dx = dx / abs(dx) * abs(dy)
4386 return dx, dy
4387
4388 p = self._pan_start
4389 dx = x - p.x
4390 dy = y - p.y
4391 if dx == dy == 0:
4392 return
4393 if button == 1:
4394 dx, dy = format_deltas(key, dx, dy)
4395 result = p.bbox.translated(-dx, -dy).transformed(p.trans_inverse)
4396 elif button == 3:
4397 try:
4398 dx = -dx / self.bbox.width
4399 dy = -dy / self.bbox.height
4400 dx, dy = format_deltas(key, dx, dy)
4401 if self.get_aspect() != 'auto':
4402 dx = dy = 0.5 * (dx + dy)
4403 alpha = np.power(10.0, (dx, dy))
4404 start = np.array([p.x, p.y])
4405 oldpoints = p.lim.transformed(p.trans)
4406 newpoints = start + alpha * (oldpoints - start)
4407 result = (mtransforms.Bbox(newpoints)
4408 .transformed(p.trans_inverse))
4409 except OverflowError:
4410 _api.warn_external('Overflow while panning')
4411 return
4412 else:
4413 return
4414
4415 valid = np.isfinite(result.transformed(p.trans))
4416 points = result.get_points().astype(object)
4417 # Just ignore invalid limits (typically, underflow in log-scale).
4418 points[~valid] = None
4419 return points
4420
4421 def drag_pan(self, button, key, x, y):
4422 """
4423 Called when the mouse moves during a pan operation.
4424
4425 Parameters
4426 ----------
4427 button : `.MouseButton`
4428 The pressed mouse button.
4429 key : str or None
4430 The pressed key, if any.
4431 x, y : float
4432 The mouse coordinates in display coords.
4433
4434 Notes
4435 -----
4436 This is intended to be overridden by new projection types.
4437 """
4438 points = self._get_pan_points(button, key, x, y)
4439 if points is not None:
4440 self.set_xlim(points[:, 0])
4441 self.set_ylim(points[:, 1])

4465
4466 def get_default_bbox_extra_artists(self):
4467 """
4468 Return a default list of artists that are used for the bounding box
4469 calculation.
4470
4471 Artists are excluded either by not being visible or
4472 ``artist.set_in_layout(False)``.
4473 """
4474
4475 artists = self.get_children()
4476
4477 for axis in self._axis_map.values():
4478 # axis tight bboxes are calculated separately inside
4479 # Axes.get_tightbbox() using for_layout_only=True
4480 artists.remove(axis)
4481 if not (self.axison and self._frameon):
4482 # don't do bbox on spines if frame not on.
4483 for spine in self.spines.values():
4484 artists.remove(spine)
4485
4486 artists.remove(self.title)
4487 artists.remove(self._left_title)
4488 artists.remove(self._right_title)
4489
4490 # always include types that do not internally implement clipping
4491 # to Axes. may have clip_on set to True and clip_box equivalent
4492 # to ax.bbox but then ignore these properties during draws.
4493 noclip = (_AxesBase, maxis.Axis,
4494 offsetbox.AnnotationBbox, offsetbox.OffsetBox)
4495 return [a for a in artists if a.get_visible() and a.get_in_layout()
4496 and (isinstance(a, noclip) or not a._fully_clipped_to_axes())]
4497
4498 def get_tightbbox(self, renderer=None, *, call_axes_locator=True,
4499 bbox_extra_artists=None, for_layout_only=False):
4500 """
4501 Return the tight bounding box of the Axes, including axis and their
4502 decorators (xlabel, title, etc).
4503
4504 Artists that have ``artist.set_in_layout(False)`` are not included
4505 in the bbox.
4506
4507 Parameters
4508 ----------
4509 renderer : `.RendererBase` subclass
4510 renderer that will be used to draw the figures (i.e.
4511 ``fig.canvas.get_renderer()``)
4512
4513 bbox_extra_artists : list of `.Artist` or ``None``
4514 List of artists to include in the tight bounding box. If
4515 ``None`` (default), then all artist children of the Axes are
4516 included in the tight bounding box.
4517
4518 call_axes_locator : bool, default: True
4519 If *call_axes_locator* is ``False``, it does not call the
4520 ``_axes_locator`` attribute, which is necessary to get the correct
4521 bounding box. ``call_axes_locator=False`` can be used if the
4522 caller is only interested in the relative size of the tightbbox
4523 compared to the Axes bbox.
4524
4525 for_layout_only : default: False
4526 The bounding box will *not* include the x-extent of the title and
4527 the xlabel, or the y-extent of the ylabel.
4528
4529 Returns
4530 -------
4531 `.BboxBase`
4532 Bounding box in figure pixel coordinates.
4533
4534 See Also
4535 --------
4536 matplotlib.axes.Axes.get_window_extent
4537 matplotlib.axis.Axis.get_tightbbox
4538 matplotlib.spines.Spine.get_window_extent
4539 """
4540
4541 bb = []
4542 if renderer is None:
4543 renderer = self.get_figure(root=True)._get_renderer()
4544
4545 if not self.get_visible():
4546 return None
4547
4548 locator = self.get_axes_locator()
4549 self.apply_aspect(
4550 locator(self, renderer) if locator and call_axes_locator else None)
4551
4552 for axis in self._axis_map.values():
4553 if self.axison and axis.get_visible():
4554 ba = martist._get_tightbbox_for_layout_only(axis, renderer)
4555 if ba:
4556 bb.append(ba)
4557 self._update_title_position(renderer)
4558 axbbox = self.get_window_extent(renderer)
4559 bb.append(axbbox)
4560
4561 for title in [self.title, self._left_title, self._right_title]:
4562 if title.get_visible():
4563 bt = title.get_window_extent(renderer)
4564 if for_layout_only and bt.width > 0:
4565 # make the title bbox 1 pixel wide so its width
4566 # is not accounted for in bbox calculations in
4567 # tight/constrained_layout
4568 bt.x0 = (bt.x0 + bt.x1) / 2 - 0.5
4569 bt.x1 = bt.x0 + 1.0
4570 bb.append(bt)
4571
4572 bbox_artists = bbox_extra_artists
4573 if bbox_artists is None:
4574 bbox_artists = self.get_default_bbox_extra_artists()
4575
4576 for a in bbox_artists:
4577 bbox = a.get_tightbbox(renderer)
4578 if (bbox is not None
4579 and 0 < bbox.width < np.inf
4580 and 0 < bbox.height < np.inf):
4581 bb.append(bbox)
4582 return mtransforms.Bbox.union(
4583 [b for b in bb if b.width != 0 or b.height != 0])
4584
4585 def _make_twin_axes(self, *args, **kwargs):
4586 """Make a twinx Axes of self. This is used for twinx and twiny."""
4587 if 'sharex' in kwargs and 'sharey' in kwargs:
4588 # The following line is added in v2.2 to avoid breaking Seaborn,
4589 # which currently uses this internal API.
4590 if kwargs["sharex"] is not self and kwargs["sharey"] is not self:
4591 raise ValueError("Twinned Axes may share only one axis")
4592 ss = self.get_subplotspec()
4593 if ss:
4594 twin = self.get_figure(root=False).add_subplot(ss, *args, **kwargs)
4595 else:
4596 twin = self.get_figure(root=False).add_axes(
4597 self.get_position(True), *args, **kwargs,
4598 axes_locator=_TransformedBoundsLocator(
4599 [0, 0, 1, 1], self.transAxes))
4600 self.set_adjustable('datalim')
4601 twin.set_adjustable('datalim')
4602 twin.set_zorder(self.zorder)
4603
4604 self._twinned_axes.join(self, twin)
4605 return twin
4606
4607 def twinx(self):
4608 """
4609 Create a twin Axes sharing the xaxis.
4610
4611 Create a new Axes with an invisible x-axis and an independent
4612 y-axis positioned opposite to the original one (i.e. at right). The
4613 x-axis autoscale setting will be inherited from the original
4614 Axes. To ensure that the tick marks of both y-axes align, see
4615 `~matplotlib.ticker.LinearLocator`.
4616
4617 Returns
4618 -------
4619 Axes
4620 The newly created Axes instance
4621
4622 Notes
4623 -----
4624 For those who are 'picking' artists while using twinx, pick
4625 events are only called for the artists in the top-most Axes.
4626 """
4627 ax2 = self._make_twin_axes(sharex=self)
4628 ax2.yaxis.tick_right()
4629 ax2.yaxis.set_label_position('right')
4630 ax2.yaxis.set_offset_position('right')
4631 ax2.set_autoscalex_on(self.get_autoscalex_on())
4632 self.yaxis.tick_left()
4633 ax2.xaxis.set_visible(False)
4634 ax2.patch.set_visible(False)
4635 ax2.xaxis.units = self.xaxis.units
4636 return ax2
4637
4638 def twiny(self):
4639 """
4640 Create a twin Axes sharing the yaxis.
4641
4642 Create a new Axes with an invisible y-axis and an independent
4643 x-axis positioned opposite to the original one (i.e. at top). The
4644 y-axis autoscale setting will be inherited from the original Axes.
4645 To ensure that the tick marks of both x-axes align, see
4646 `~matplotlib.ticker.LinearLocator`.
4647
4648 Returns
4649 -------
4650 Axes
4651 The newly created Axes instance
4652
4653 Notes
4654 -----
4655 For those who are 'picking' artists while using twiny, pick
4656 events are only called for the artists in the top-most Axes.
4657 """
4658 ax2 = self._make_twin_axes(sharey=self)
4659 ax2.xaxis.tick_top()
4660 ax2.xaxis.set_label_position('top')
4661 ax2.set_autoscaley_on(self.get_autoscaley_on())
4662 self.xaxis.tick_bottom()
4663 ax2.yaxis.set_visible(False)
4664 ax2.patch.set_visible(False)
4665 ax2.yaxis.units = self.yaxis.units
4666 return ax2
4667
4668 def get_shared_x_axes(self):
4669 """Return an immutable view on the shared x-axes Grouper."""
4670 return cbook.GrouperView(self._shared_axes["x"])
4671
4672 def get_shared_y_axes(self):
4673 """Return an immutable view on the shared y-axes Grouper."""
4674 return cbook.GrouperView(self._shared_axes["y"])
4675
4676 def label_outer(self, remove_inner_ticks=False):
4677 """
4678 Only show "outer" labels and tick labels.
4679
4680 x-labels are only kept for subplots on the last row (or first row, if
4681 labels are on the top side); y-labels only for subplots on the first
4682 column (or last column, if labels are on the right side).
4683
4684 Parameters
4685 ----------
4686 remove_inner_ticks : bool, default: False
4687 If True, remove the inner ticks as well (not only tick labels).
4688
4689 .. versionadded:: 3.8
4690 """
4691 self._label_outer_xaxis(skip_non_rectangular_axes=False,
4692 remove_inner_ticks=remove_inner_ticks)
4693 self._label_outer_yaxis(skip_non_rectangular_axes=False,
4694 remove_inner_ticks=remove_inner_ticks)
4695
4696 def _label_outer_xaxis(self, *, skip_non_rectangular_axes,
4697 remove_inner_ticks=False):
4698 # see documentation in label_outer.
4699 if skip_non_rectangular_axes and not isinstance(self.patch,
4700 mpl.patches.Rectangle):
4701 return
4702 ss = self.get_subplotspec()
4703 if not ss:
4704 return
4705 label_position = self.xaxis.get_label_position()
4706 if not ss.is_first_row(): # Remove top label/ticklabels/offsettext.
4707 if label_position == "top":
4708 self.set_xlabel("")
4709 top_kw = {'top': False} if remove_inner_ticks else {}
4710 self.xaxis.set_tick_params(
4711 which="both", labeltop=False, **top_kw)
4712 if self.xaxis.offsetText.get_position()[1] == 1:
4713 self.xaxis.offsetText.set_visible(False)
4714 if not ss.is_last_row(): # Remove bottom label/ticklabels/offsettext.
4715 if label_position == "bottom":
4716 self.set_xlabel("")
4717 bottom_kw = {'bottom': False} if remove_inner_ticks else {}
4718 self.xaxis.set_tick_params(
4719 which="both", labelbottom=False, **bottom_kw)
4720 if self.xaxis.offsetText.get_position()[1] == 0:
4721 self.xaxis.offsetText.set_visible(False)
4722
4723 def _label_outer_yaxis(self, *, skip_non_rectangular_axes,
4724 remove_inner_ticks=False):
4725 # see documentation in label_outer.
4726 if skip_non_rectangular_axes and not isinstance(self.patch,
4727 mpl.patches.Rectangle):
4728 return
4729 ss = self.get_subplotspec()
4730 if not ss:
4731 return
4732 label_position = self.yaxis.get_label_position()
4733 if not ss.is_first_col(): # Remove left label/ticklabels/offsettext.
4734 if label_position == "left":
4735 self.set_ylabel("")
4736 left_kw = {'left': False} if remove_inner_ticks else {}
4737 self.yaxis.set_tick_params(
4738 which="both", labelleft=False, **left_kw)
4739 if self.yaxis.offsetText.get_position()[0] == 0:
4740 self.yaxis.offsetText.set_visible(False)
4741 if not ss.is_last_col(): # Remove right label/ticklabels/offsettext.
4742 if label_position == "right":
4743 self.set_ylabel("")
4744 right_kw = {'right': False} if remove_inner_ticks else {}
4745 self.yaxis.set_tick_params(
4746 which="both", labelright=False, **right_kw)
4747 if self.yaxis.offsetText.get_position()[0] == 1:
4748 self.yaxis.offsetText.set_visible(False)
4749
4750 def set_forward_navigation_events(self, forward):
4751 """
4752 Set how pan/zoom events are forwarded to Axes below this one.
4753
4754 Parameters
4755 ----------
4756 forward : bool or "auto"
4757 Possible values:
4758
4759 - True: Forward events to other axes with lower or equal zorder.
4760 - False: Events are only executed on this axes.
4761 - "auto": Default behaviour (*True* for axes with an invisible
4762 patch and *False* otherwise)
4763
4764 See Also
4765 --------
4766 matplotlib.axes.Axes.set_navigate
4767
4768 """
4769 self._forward_navigation_events = forward
4770
4771 def get_forward_navigation_events(self):
4772 """Get how pan/zoom events are forwarded to Axes below this one."""
4773 return self._forward_navigation_events

4775
4776def _draw_rasterized(figure, artists, renderer):
4777 """
4778 A helper function for rasterizing the list of artists.
4779
4780 The bookkeeping to track if we are or are not in rasterizing mode
4781 with the mixed-mode backends is relatively complicated and is now
4782 handled in the matplotlib.artist.allow_rasterization decorator.
4783
4784 This helper defines the absolute minimum methods and attributes on a
4785 shim class to be compatible with that decorator and then uses it to
4786 rasterize the list of artists.
4787
4788 This is maybe too-clever, but allows us to reuse the same code that is
4789 used on normal artists to participate in the "are we rasterizing"
4790 accounting.
4791
4792 Please do not use this outside of the "rasterize below a given zorder"
4793 functionality of Axes.
4794
4795 Parameters
4796 ----------
4797 figure : matplotlib.figure.Figure
4798 The figure all of the artists belong to (not checked). We need this
4799 because we can at the figure level suppress composition and insert each
4800 rasterized artist as its own image.
4801
4802 artists : List[matplotlib.artist.Artist]
4803 The list of Artists to be rasterized. These are assumed to all
4804 be in the same Figure.
4805
4806 renderer : matplotlib.backendbases.RendererBase
4807 The currently active renderer
4808
4809 Returns
4810 -------
4811 None
4812
4813 """
4814 class _MinimalArtist:
4815 def get_rasterized(self):
4816 return True
4817
4818 def get_agg_filter(self):
4819 return None
4820
4821 def __init__(self, figure, artists):
4822 self.figure = figure
4823 self.artists = artists
4824
4825 def get_figure(self, root=False):
4826 if root:
4827 return self.figure.get_figure(root=True)
4828 else:
4829 return self.figure
4830
4831 @martist.allow_rasterization
4832 def draw(self, renderer):
4833 for a in self.artists:
4834 a.draw(renderer)
4835
4836 return _MinimalArtist(figure, artists).draw(renderer)
